comments.body: Might want to add this to our issue.  I suspect that this command will need updating to handle multiple potential output group/versions for a given list.

I don't think it's useful to support multiple group/versions in the outputVersion flag of the conversion tool. IMO, if a user needs to convert multiple objects belong to different groups, it's clearer if he calls the tool multiple times.

> I don't think it's useful to support multiple group/versions in the outputVersion flag of the conversion tool. IMO, if a user needs to convert multiple objects belong to different groups, it's clearer if he calls the tool multiple times.

It will probably come up when you deal with converting items inside of lists, but it's not a sticking point for me.
That's true. I think that deserves an issue of its own. Let's deal with it when we hit the problem.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +40,44 @@	outputDest    = flag.StringP("output", "o", "-", "Output destination; '-' means stdout")
	rewrite       = flag.StringP("rewrite", "r", "", "If nonempty, use this as both input and output.")
	outputVersion = flag.StringP("out-version", "v", latest.GroupOrDie("").GroupVersion.Version, "Version to convert input to")
)

comments.body: Thanks for fixing, I agree this should probably get a package and a test.
